Description: Egyptian blue striding figure of Amun, lacking the head. Wears a shendyt kilt and rests against an integral back-pillar, the back of which bears a vertical line of hieroglyphs containing the titulary of a king, perhaps intended for Pepi I but incorrectly written. On the right side of the back-pillar is a kneeling figure of a king in incised relief, with arms raised in adoration. On top of the plinth the nine bows are incised below the feet of the figure.
Curator's comments: Published: L. Gabolde in L. Gabolde (ed), Hommages a Jean-Claude Goyon (BdE 143, 2008): 164-80 [with earlier bibliography] Dated to 6th dynasty by Daumas (BIFAO 65: 213-14), Dynasties 22-30 by Gabolde.
Acquisition notes: Gabolde states that it was first noted by Wiedemann in 1881 at Thebes, before being acquired by Chester.
